oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FIELD STUDIES OF BUOYANT JET IN COASTAL WATERS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Leighton, Jeffrey P.
Tu, Shuen-Wei Scott
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: jet
buoyant jet
field study
coastal jet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Studies were made on a surface buoyant jet from a coastal power plant. The cooling water discharges into shallow waters of irregular bottom topography forming a partially enclosed embayment that connects to the open ocean. Near field mixing was found to be influenced by bottom bathymetry, lateral confinement and a large obstruction. Surface centerline temperature decay, bottom separation and the heat and mass distribution within the embayment were analyzed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 20 (1986): Proceedings of 20th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Taipei, Taiwan, 1986.; 191
